intro: Lepechinia fragrans, commonly known as sweet everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are often used in herbal remedies due to their soothing properties. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
